channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The latest on the murder of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk
item.description: The person who shot and killed right-wing activist Charlie Kirk is still at large. On Thursday, officials shared photos and video of a suspect running from the scene. NPR reports on the latest.
item.content:encoded: The person who shot and killed right-wing activist Charlie Kirk is still at large. On Thursday, officials shared photos and video of a suspect running from the scene. NPR reports on the latest.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Police share video of Charlie Kirk shooting person of interest. And, prices rise
item.description: Police shared photos and a video of a person fleeing from the scene after Charlie Kirk was fatally shot. Plus, inflation is rising, and the job market is weakening. So why are stocks soaring?
item.content:encoded: Police shared photos and a video of a person fleeing from the scene after Charlie Kirk was fatally shot. Plus, inflation is rising, and the job market is weakening. So why are stocks soaring?

item.title: Prince Harry makes surprise visit to Ukraine in support of wounded troops
item.description: Britain's Prince Harry has arrived in Ukraine for a surprise visit in support of wounded service members.
item.content:encoded:
Britain's Prince Harry has arrived in Ukraine for a surprise visit in support of wounded service members.

(Image credit: Railway of Ukraine Ukrzaliznytsia)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why mothers in the U.S. are scaling back on their work lives
item.description: Workforce participation for moms in the U.S. has been dropping for most of this year, and the reasons are more complicated than return-to-office mandates. The team from "The Indicator" explains why.
item.content:encoded: Workforce participation for moms in the U.S. has been dropping for most of this year, and the reasons are more complicated than return-to-office mandates. The team from "The Indicator" explains why.
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: Insect populations drop even without direct human interference, a new study finds
item.description: Research published this month found that even in pristine, untouched areas, insect populations are still on the decline. Climate change is a likely culprit.
item.content:encoded:
Research published this month found that even in pristine, untouched areas, insect populations are still on the decline. Climate change is a likely culprit.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Something big collapsed this week — again. Do you know what? Take our quiz
item.description: This week, we had news of a drawing that may or may not be the president's, and of a rock that may or may not indicate that Mars had life.
item.content:encoded: This week, we had news of a drawing that may or may not be the president's, and of a rock that may or may not indicate that Mars had life.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: This shop fixes student instruments for free. Now, a music legend is chipping in
item.description: Herb Alpert got his start playing trumpet in L.A.'s public schools. He wants to help make that "magic" possible for students.
item.content:encoded:
Herb Alpert got his start playing trumpet in L.A.'s public schools. He wants to help make that "magic" possible for students.

(Image credit: Jonaki Mehta)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: COMIC: 7 signs it's time to call it quits
item.description: It's hard to know when to give up on a goal, especially when you've invested so much time, effort and resources into it. Here are 7 signals you might be ready to move on.
item.content:encoded: It's hard to know when to give up on a goal, especially when you've invested so much time, effort and resources into it. Here are 7 signals you might be ready to move on.
item.dc:creator: Connie Hanzhang Jin

item.title: Wary of RFK Jr., Colorado started revamping its vaccine policies last spring
item.description: While Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., dismantles the federal institutions that set vaccine policy, states like Colorado are changing laws and regulations in an effort to preserve access to vaccines.
item.content:encoded:
While Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., dismantles the federal institutions that set vaccine policy, states like Colorado are changing laws and regulations in an effort to preserve access to vaccines.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski)
item.dc:creator: John Daley

item.title: Health care costs are soaring. Blame insurers, drug companies — and your employer
item.description: Some 154 million people in the United States get health care through their employer — and for many, their costs are about to go way up.
item.content:encoded:
Some 154 million people in the United States get health care through their employer — and for many, their costs are about to go way up.

(Image credit: Jeff Chiu)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan
